did.head: Collection Summary

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English, with Hebrew

did.abstract: Republican pollster and political consultant. Correspondence, polls, clippings, memoranda, travel books, calendars, and other papers relating to Finkelstein's career as a Republican consultant and campaign manager.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The papers of Arthur J. Finkelstein were given to the Library by his husband, Donald Curiale, in 2021.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of Arthur J. Finkelstein were arranged and described in 2022 by Michael Folkerts with the assistance of Tammi Taylor and Rosa Hernandez.

Digital files were received as part of the Arthur Finkelstein papers on a variety of storage media, each of which was assigned a unique digital ID number. Use the digital ID number to request access copies of the files associated with each media. A description of the standard processes taken on all born digital records can be found in the Processing History Note: Born Digital Collection Material at https://hdl.loc.gov/loc.mss/eadmss.digital. Empty files, temporary files, and extraneous program files were removed during processing.

separatedmaterial.head: Transfers
separatedmaterial.p: Audio and video cassettes have been transferred to the Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division where they are identified as part of the Arthur J. Finkelstein Papers. Patrons are encouraged to contact the Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division in advance of a research visit.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of Arthur J. Finkelstein is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Arthur J. Finkelstein are open to research. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use. Access to digital content is available onsite only in the Manuscript Reading Room and requires advanced notice. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting.

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Digital files were created mostly in a Windows operating system, version unknown. Files include .vob, WordPerfect, Microsoft Word, Plain text, .zip, and unidentified text and database files.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container or digital ID number, Arthur J. Finkelstein Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Born, Brooklyn, New York City, N.Y.
B.A., Queens College, Queens, New York, N.Y.
Pollster and computer analyst, NBC News, New York, N.Y.
Computer programmer, New York Stock Exchange, New York, N.Y.
Consultant, James L. Buckley United States Senate campaign, N.Y.
Director of demographics and election analysis, Richard M. Nixon, presidential campaign
Inducted, American Association of Political Consultants Hall of Fame

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers of Arthur J. Finkelstein span the years 1960-2019, with the bulk of the material dating from 1970 to 1989. The collection documents Finkelstein's work as a pollster and Republican political consultant. The papers are arranged into five series: Consultant File, Alphabetical File, Travel and Itineraries File, Personal File and Oversize.

After founding his political consulting company AJF & Associates, Finkelstein played a major part in the wave of Republican victories and the rise of the New Right during the 1970s and 1980s. The collection focuses almost entirely on his professional career and highlights the evolution of campaigns, fundraising, and messaging in this era. The Consultant File in particular demonstrates these changes as it showcases Finkelstein’s hands-on role as a campaign manager or consultant for a number of races. However, as Finkelstein’s involvement varied from race to race, not every campaign has extensive documentation.
The collection’s series are listed and briefly described below. A fuller description of each series and a list of its contents can be accessed in the series descriptions within the container list.
The Consultant File documents the mostly political work of Arthur J. Finkelstein, containing memoranda, polls, and other material related to various campaigns or organizations.
The Alphabetical File contains a mix of Finkelstein's working files, correspondence, and a variety of topics primarily concerned with Finkelstein's professional life.
The Travel and Itineraries File contains Finkelstein's scheduling books, detailing trips and meetings.
The Personal File contains a small collection of various material concerning Finkelstein's college years and family.
Oversize contains Rolodex cards, a scrapbook page, and a campaign poster.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in five series:

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: The Consultant File documents the mostly political work of Arthur J. Finkelstein, containing memorandum, polls, and other material related to various campaigns or organizations. Specifically, the series contains material primarily from AJF & Associates, the polling and consulting company founded by Finkelstein. The firm specialized in political consulting for Republican candidates, and Finkelstein’s polling, coupled with direct mail for campaign fundraising and the use of independent expenditures, helped lead to a wave of Republican victories in the 1980s. The work for these campaigns could range from a simple poll to complete campaign management, where Finkelstein consulted on the crafting of oft-negative television and radio advertisements, direct mail letters, and other general advisement. Consequently, the amount of material in this series can vary from client to client. Some of the most noteworthy clients represented in this series are: James Lane Buckley, Alphonse D’Amato, Jesse Helms, Judy Koehler, Ronald S. Lauder, Don Nickles, Connie Mack III, and Denny Smith. Alongside individual candidates, Finkelstein played important roles in political action committees, such as the National Conservative Political Action Committee and the National Congressional Club. Later in his career, he helped consult for campaigns overseas, the most notable featured in this series being the National Citizen’s Coalition in Canada and the Likud party in Israel, where he managed the campaigns for Prime Ministers Benjamin Netanyahu and Ariel Sharon. Also represented in this series is the influence Finkelstein exercised in shaping state politics in New York, specifically in Long Island.
Material types include correspondence, memoranda, polls, notes, and news clippings.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of political candidate or client. The file structure of the digital content maintained as received.

scopecontent.p: The Alphabetical File contains a mix of Finkelstein's working files, correspondence, and a variety of topics primarily concerned with his professional life. The series is an expansion of a file arrangement managed by Finkelstein, though it is unclear whether these files were kept for AJF & Associates or personal use. Some noteworthy contents of this series feature material related to his board membership to the American Conservative Union and the libertarian consumer advocacy group Consumer Alert, AJF & Associates proposals, and the response by Finkelstein and friends to an article published by Boston Magazine that publicly outed him as gay. Notable correspondents and gathered subject material in this series includes John Terry Dolan, Joan Ferdinand, Jeane J. Kirkpatrick, Gerald "Gerry" Nicholls, and Roger Stone, . Also included are speeches, interviews, and articles written by Finkelstein.
Material types include correspondence, news clippings, articles, and message books.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name, organization, or subject. The file structure of the digital content maintained as received.

scopecontent.p: The Travel and Itineraries File contains Finkelstein's scheduling books, detailing trips and meetings.
Material types include schedule books and itineraries.

The Personal File contains a small collection of material concerning Finkelstein's college years and family. The most notable portion of this series includes writings, notes, and clippings from Finkelstein's time as an undergraduate at Queen's College, New York. The writings are of particular interest, containing poems and letters written by him and a classmate which reveal a brief glimpse as to how Finkelstein viewed himself at that time. Also included are papers related to his family.
Material types include notes, letters, correspondence, articles, and news clippings.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by subject or type of material.

scopecontent.p: Material includes Rolodex cards, a scrapbook page, and a campaign poster.

arrangement.p: Listed and described according to the series, subseries, containers, and folders from which the items were separated.
